author: Morgana
title: Biden Forced to Back Down After Lawsuit, Allows Catholic Group to Hold Mass at National Cemetery
text:
Biden officials have back down in the face of multiple lawsuits after the National Park Service denied, for the second year in a row, the Knights of Columbus’ request to host a Memorial Day Mass inside a national cemetery.
The Knights have hosted the annual Memorial Day Mass inside Poplar Grove National Cemetery in Petersburg, Virginia since the 1960’s.
On May 21, First Liberty Institute and McGuireWoods LLP filed a motion for a temporary restraining order and preliminary injunction against National Park Service, so that the Knights can continue on with hosting their annual Memorial Day Mass at the Cemetery. NPS denied the Knights a permit, citing a new policy that designated “religious services” as prohibited “demonstrations.” That policy said religious services must be held somewhere outside the cemetery, even though other events may be held in the cemetery.
According to First Liberty, the National Park Service denied the Knights a permit to host the Mass because a policy change prohibits “demonstrations,” including religious services, in the cemetery. It explained to the court that government cannot disfavor faith-based organizations and gatherings simply because they’re religious. In fact, under the First Amendment and other federal law, religion and religious groups receive favored treatment and protection.
In the wake of the lawsuit, Biden officials have allowed the service to move forward.
First Liberty reached an agreement with National Park Service, which granted a permit to allow the religious service to take place at the cemetery grounds.
“The Knights are thrilled that they will be able to exercise their religious beliefs and keep this honorable tradition alive. We appreciate the tremendous support of Governor Youngkin and Attorney General Miyares in this case,” said First Liberty Senior Counsel Roger Byron.
“We are grateful to the NPS for allowing the Knights to hold their service this Memorial Day,” said John Moran, Partner at McGuireWoods.
The group added:
This is an incredibly important victory for the Knights of Columbus. They’ve held their Memorial Day Mass at the cemetery every year since at least the 1960s. For them—like for millions of Americans—it’s a time-honored tradition to pray for and honor our nation’s fallen soldiers.
We’re really glad the Knights will be able to hold their mass this Memorial Day. First Liberty will continue fighting for people and religious groups of all faiths so they don’t face unlawful discrimination. Like everyone else, religious groups should have an equal opportunity to honor and pray for the military heroes who gave their lives in service to our nation.

author: reporters@dailyrecord.co.uk (Kenny Macdonald)
title: Storm Gerrit causes travel problems and power cuts across Dumfries and Galloway
text:
A driver had to be rescued from a submerged car as Storm Gerrit battered Dumfries and Galloway on Wednesday.
The drama unfolded on the old military road from Lochfoot to Dumfries.
Power was cut to dozens of homes as the storm raged.
And transport was hit badly with flooding and falling trees blocking roads, while train services were disrupted. Dozens of homes were affected by power cuts and persistent heavy rain which also caused some localised flooding across the region, including the Whitesands in Dumfries.
Dumfries and Galloway Council took the step of posting a Virtual Operations Support Team (VOST) warning list of live incidents on roads and of flooding to keep the public informed.
Trains were cancelled on Wednesday from Glasgow to Dumfries and yesterday there were no early services from Kilmarnock to Dumfries.
And a spokesperson for SP Energy Networks said on Wednesday: “We’re experiencing some storm-related incidents affecting our network in Borgue, Whithorn and Castle Kennedy, with around 50 customers currently off supply.
A message posted on Facebook on Wednesday told how the Boathouse cafe and restaurant at Glencaple near Dumfries would be shut due to flooded access roads.
And another social media post on Wednesday told how a driver had to be rescued on the old military road.
Meanwhile, police said yesterday that cars were trapped on Glencaple Road due to warning signs being ignored.
The Met Office said that 20 to 45mm of rain was expected in 24 hours until yesterday in Scotland along with winds reaching 60 to 70mph in some areas.
And according to meteorologist Geoff Monk of Laurieston, the storm was much more remarkable for rain amounts than wind speeds.
 Speaking at 1pm on Wednesday, he said: “From 2am this morning we have had 50mm – it was absolutely throwing it down. And west of Glasgow they had 35mm in six hours.
“It’s a really wet system but it is pushing north quite quickly. We have had the worst but that’s not to say it’s finished.”

author: Daniel Cabodevilla
title: Un susto o una catarata por la escalera: el peligro de dejarse el grifo abierto en vacaciones
text: De un susto a una catarata por la escalera: las consecuencias de dejarse el grifo abierto en vacaciones José Antonio Samper, jefe de intervención de los Bomberos de Zaragoza, afirma que estas situaciones se dan "prácticamente a diario" y explica cómo las afrontan. Durante los meses de verano, [las familias suelen pasar largas temporadas fuera de casa](https://www.heraldo.es/noticias/aragon/2024/07/08/consejos-evitar-robos-vivienda-verano-aragon-1747401.html) y es habitual que se produzcan incidentes en las viviendas relacionados con fugas de agua. Averías, roturas de tuberías o descuidos a la hora de dejar grifos abiertos pueden desencadenar graves problemas de fugas que, en el caso de que no haya nadie en la vivienda para ponerle rápida solución, pueden resultar fatales en la mayoría de los casos. José Antonio Samper, jefe de intervención del cuerpo de B [omberos de Zaragoza](https://www.heraldo.es/tags/instituciones_empresas/bomberos_zaragoza.html), asegura que durante el verano atienden incidencias de este tipo “casi a diario”. “Se producen durante todo el año y casi todas las solucionan a tiempo los propios usuarios, pero en verano, como a veces no hay nadie en casa cuando estalla el problema, el destrozo suele ser mayor”, relata. En la madrugada del pasado viernes 23 de julio, los Bomberos de Zaragoza tuvieron que acceder al interior de una vivienda de [Casetas ](https://www.heraldo.es/tags/lugares/casetas.html)cuando, tras una fuga, el agua se filtró por el suelo y comenzó a caer del techo del bar de debajo. En aquella ocasión, ante las dificultades de entrar por la puerta, los bomberos tuvieron que acceder por el balcón ayudados por la grúa del camión. “Lo primero que tenemos que hacer es comprobar si el problema puede solucionarse sin necesidad de entrar a la vivienda. Una vez que nos cercioramos de que el corte del agua no se puede acometer desde la sala de contadores común, llega el momento de actuar. Si no hay nadie en casa, intentamos entrar por la puerta sin romperla, pero en el caso de no lograrlo, buscamos alternativas”, explica. Samper asegura que para poder forzar la puerta y acceder al interior de la vivienda es necesario que haya “miembros de la Policía Local o Policía Nacional presentes”, y que, en el caso de no contactar con los propietarios de la misma, se les deja una nota explicando el motivo por el que han tenido que entrar. En el caso de que haya una gran cantidad de agua acumulada, el procedimiento habitual suele ser la retirada de la misma a través de retrete: “Retiramos el retrete de su sitio y tratamos de vaciar toda el agua a través de ese agujero. Luego, lo volvemos a colocar”. La mayor parte de los edificios antiguos tienen los contadores del agua en el interior de las viviendas, por lo que las intervenciones a la hora de detener una fuga suelen ser más costosas. “A lo largo de todos mis años de experiencia he visto de todo. Desde una fuga de agua en un séptimo piso en la que el agua bajaba en cascada por las escaleras, hasta casos en los que hay una fuga en un cuarto piso y, como el tercero y el segundo están vacíos, nadie da la voz de alarma hasta que el agua le llega al del primero”, relata. La importancia de cerrar el agua a la hora de viajar Ante la relativa frecuencia con la que suelen producirse este tipo de episodios, Samper incide en la importancia de tomar precauciones cuando nos disponemos a abandonar la vivienda durante un largo periodo de tiempo: “Desde aquí quiero invitar a la ciudadanía a que, si se van fuera durante varios días, corten el agua. Es un simple gesto que puede ahorrar más de un susto”. “Del mismo modo que muchos incendios en viviendas se podrían controlar cerrando la puerta de la habitación en la que se ha originado el fuego, con las fugas de agua sucede lo mismo. Al volver a casa, es tan sencillo como abrir uno de los grifos para que expulse el aire acumulado y volver a abrir la llave del agua”, concluye. [Regístrate gratis](#) [Iniciar sesión](#)

title: UAE welcomes UNSC resolution calling for ceasefire in Sudan during Ramadan | World News - Business Standard
text:
The UAE has welcomed the UN Security Council resolution which calls for a ceasefire in Sudan during Ramadan, in light of the continued deterioration of the humanitarian situation. In a statement, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MoFA) expressed hope that this step would lead towards ending the crisis between the Sudanese parties, preventing further suffering of the Sudanese people, and facilitating the arrival of relief and humanitarian aid to the affected areas, especially for the most vulnerable groups, including the sick, children, the elderly and women.
